meanings.def: a long piece of cloth with a message on it that is carried between two poles or hung in a public place to show support for something
examples: A huge banner over the street said ‘Welcome home’.
Protesters carried a banner reading ‘Save our Wildlife’.
The demonstrators carried banners bearing various slogans.
They marched forward with banners waving in the wind.
A banner strung across the road read, ‘Welcome home, boys!’

meanings.def: claiming to support a particular set of ideas
examples: They fought the election under the banner of ‘No new taxes’.

meanings.def: as part of a particular group or organization
examples: Troops are in the country under the banner of the United Nations.
